ccnseqwriter.c

00001 /**
00002  * @file ccnseqwriter.c
00003  * Streams data from stdin into ccn
00004  *
00005  * A CCNx command-line utility.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (C) 2010-2013 Palo Alto Research Center, Inc.
00008  *
00009  * This work is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00010  * the terms of the GNU General Public License version 2 as published by the
00011  * Free Software Foundation.
00012  * This work is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY

00020 #include <errno.h>
00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 #include <stdlib.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <unistd.h>
00025 #include <memory.h>
00026 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00027 #include <ccn/uri.h>
00028 #include <ccn/seqwriter.h>
00029 
00030 static void
00031 usage(const char *progname)
00032 {
00033         fprintf(stderr,
00034                 "%s [-h] [-b 0<blocksize<=4096] [-r] [-o keystore-directory] [-d digest] [-p password] ccnx:/some/uri\n"
00035                 "    Reads stdin, sending data under the given URI"
00036                 " using ccn versioning and segmentation.\n"
00037                 "    -h generate this help message.\n"
00038                 "    -b specify the block (segment) size for content objects.  Default 1024.\n"
00039                 "    -r generate start-write interest so a repository will"
00040                 " store the content.\n"
00041                 "    -s n set scope of start-write interest.\n"
00042                 "       n = 1(local), 2(neighborhood), 3(everywhere) Default 1.\n"
00043                 "    -x specify the freshness for content objects.\n"
00044                 "    -o specify a directory for symmetric keystore\n"
00045                 "    -d specify a symmetric digest to use a symmetric key.\n"
00046                 "    -p specify a password for a symmetric keystore.\n",
00047                 progname);
00048         exit(1);
00049 }
00050 /*
00051  * make_template: construct an interest template containing the specified scope
00052  *     An unlimited scope is passed in as 3, and the omission of the scope
00053  *     field from the template indicates this.
00054  */
00055 struct ccn_charbuf *
00056 make_template(int scope)
00057 {
00058     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
00059     templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
00060     ccnb_element_begin(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest);
00061     ccnb_element_begin(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name);
00062     ccnb_element_end(templ); /* </Name> */
00063     if (0 <= scope && scope <= 2)
00064         ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_Scope, "%d", scope);
00065     ccnb_element_end(templ); /* </Interest> */
00066     return(templ);
00067 }
00068 
00069 int
00070 main(int argc, char **argv)
00071 {
00072     const char *progname = argv[0];
00073     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
00074     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
00075     struct ccn_seqwriter *w = NULL;
00076     int blocksize = 1024;
00077     int freshness = -1;
00078     int torepo = 0;
00079     int scope = 1;
00080     int i;
00081     int status = 0;
00082     int res;
00083     ssize_t read_res;
00084     size_t blockread;
00085     unsigned char *buf = NULL;
00086     struct ccn_charbuf *templ;
00087     char *symmetric_suffix = NULL;
00088     const char *password = NULL;
00089     char *dir = NULL;
00090     
00091     while ((res = getopt(argc, argv, "hrb:s:x:d:p:o:")) != -1) {
00092         switch (res) {
00093             case 'b':
00094                 blocksize = atoi(optarg);
00095                 if (blocksize <= 0 || blocksize > 4096)
00096                     usage(progname);
00097                 break;
00098             case 'r':
00099                 torepo = 1;
00100                 break;
00101             case 's':
00102                 scope = atoi(optarg);
00103                 if (scope < 1 || scope > 3)
00104                     usage(progname);
00105                 break;
00106             case 'x':
00107                 freshness = atoi(optarg);
00108                 if (freshness < 0)
00109                     usage(progname);
00110                 break;
00111             case 'd':
00112                 symmetric_suffix = optarg;
00113                 break;
00114             case 'p':
00115                 password = optarg;
00116                 break;
00117             case 'o':
00118                 dir = optarg;
00119                 break;
00120             case 'h':
00121                 usage(progname);
00122                 break;
00123         }
00124     }
00125     argc -= optind;
00126     argv += optind;
00127     if (argc != 1)
00128         usage(progname);
00129     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00130     res = ccn_name_from_uri(name, argv[0]);
00131     if (res < 0) {
00132         fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad CCN URI: %s\n", progname, argv[0]);
00133         exit(1);
00134     }
00135     ccn = ccn_create();
00136     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
00137         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
00138         exit(1);
00139     }
00140     
00141     buf = calloc(1, blocksize);
00142     
00143     w = ccn_seqw_create(ccn, name);
00144     if (w == NULL) {
00145         fprintf(stderr, "ccn_seqw_create failed\n");
00146         exit(1);
00147     }
00148 
00149     if (symmetric_suffix != NULL) {
00150         struct ccn_charbuf *key_digest = ccn_charbuf_create();
00151 
00152         if (ccn_get_key_digest_from_suffix(ccn, dir, symmetric_suffix, password, key_digest)) {
00153             perror("Can't access keystore");
00154             exit(1);
00155         }
00156         ccn_seqw_set_key_digest(w, key_digest->buf, key_digest->length);
00157         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&key_digest);
00158     }
00159     
00160     ccn_seqw_set_block_limits(w, blocksize, blocksize);
00161     if (freshness > -1)
00162         ccn_seqw_set_freshness(w, freshness);
00163     if (torepo) {
00164         struct ccn_charbuf *name_v = ccn_charbuf_create();
00165         ccn_seqw_get_name(w, name_v);
00166         ccn_name_from_uri(name_v, "%C1.R.sw");
00167         ccn_name_append_nonce(name_v);
00168         templ = make_template(scope);
00169         res = ccn_get(ccn, name_v, templ, 60000, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00170         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&templ);
00171         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name_v);
00172         if (res < 0) {
00173             fprintf(stderr, "No response from repository\n");
00174             exit(1);
00175         }
00176     }
00177     blockread = 0;
00178     for (i = 0;; i++) {
00179         while (blockread < blocksize) {
00180             if (ccn_run(ccn, 1) < 0) {
00181                 fprintf(stderr, "Lost connection to ccnd: %s\n",
00182                         strerror(ccn_geterror(ccn)));
00183                 exit(1);
00184             }
00185             read_res = read(0, buf + blockread, blocksize - blockread);
00186             if (read_res == 0)
00187                 goto cleanup;
00188             if (read_res < 0) {
00189                 perror("read");
00190                 status = 1;
00191                 goto cleanup;
00192             }
00193             blockread += read_res;
00194         }
00195         res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00196         while (res == -1) {
00197             if (ccn_run(ccn, 100) < 0) {
00198                 fprintf(stderr, "Lost connection to ccnd: %s\n",
00199                         strerror(ccn_geterror(ccn)));
00200                 exit(1);
00201             }
00202             res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00203         }
00204         if (res != blockread)
00205             abort(); /* hmm, ccn_seqw_write did a short write or something */
00206         blockread = 0;
00207     }
00208     
00209 cleanup:
00210     // flush out any remaining data and close
00211     if (blockread > 0) {
00212         res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00213         while (res == -1) {
00214             if (ccn_run(ccn, 100) < 0) {
00215                 fprintf(stderr, "Lost connection to ccnd: %s\n",
00216                         strerror(ccn_geterror(ccn)));
00217                 exit(1);
00218             }
00219             res = ccn_seqw_write(w, buf, blockread);
00220         }
00221     }
00222     ccn_seqw_close(w);
00223     ccn_run(ccn, 1);
00224     free(buf);
00225     buf = NULL;
00226     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00227     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
00228     exit(status);
00229 }
